RN   [6]
RP   FUNCTION.
RX   PubMed=24030830; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M113.507038;
RA   Xiao J., Zhou Y., Lai H., Lei S., Chi L.H., Mo X.;
RT   "Transcription factor NF-Y is a functional regulator of the
RT   transcription of core clock gene Bmal1.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 288:31930-31936(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Transcription factor that can activate or repress
CC       transcription in response to physiological and pathological
CC       stimuli. Binds with high affinity to GC-rich motifs and regulates
CC       the expression of a large number of genes involved in a variety of
CC       processes such as cell growth, apoptosis, differentiation and
CC       immune responses. Highly regulated by post-translational
CC       modifications (phosphorylations, sumoylation, proteolytic
CC       cleavage, glycosylation and acetylation). Binds also the PDGFR-
CC       alpha G-box promoter. May have a role in modulating the cellular
CC       response to DNA damage. Implicated in chromatin remodeling. Plays
CC       a role in the recruitment of SMARCA4/BRG1 on the c-FOS promoter
CC       Plays an essential role in the regulation of FE65 gene expression
CC       (By similarity). Positively regulates the transcription of the
CC       core clock component ARNTL/BMAL1. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24030830}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with ATF7IP, ATF7IP2, BAHD1, POGZ, HCFC1, AATF
CC       and PHC2. Interacts with SV40 VP2/3 proteins. Interacts with SV40
CC       major capsid protein VP1; this interaction leads to a
CC       cooperativity between the 2 proteins in DNA binding. Interacts
CC       with HLTF; the interaction may be required for basal
CC       transcriptional activity of HLTF. Interacts (deacetylated form)
CC       with EP300; the interaction enhances gene expression. Interacts
CC       with HDAC1 and JUN. Interacts with ELF1; the interaction is
CC       inhibited by glycosylation of SP1. Interaction with NFYA; the
CC       interaction is inhibited by glycosylation of SP1. Interacts with
CC       SMARCA4/BRG1. Interacts with ATF7IP and TBP. Interacts with MEIS2
CC       isoform 4 and PBX1 isoform PBX1a. Interacts with EGR1 (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Nuclear location is governed by glycosylated/phosphorylated
CC       states. Insulin promotes nuclear location, while glucagon favors
CC       cytoplasmic location (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=O89090-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Sp1-S;
CC         IsoId=O89090-2; Sequence=VSP_007376;
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated on multiple serine and threonine residues.
CC       Phosphorylation is coupled to ubiquitination, sumoylation and
CC       proteolytic processing. Phosphorylation on Ser-61 enhances
CC       proteolytic cleavage. Phosphorylation on Ser-7 enhances
CC       ubiquitination and protein degradation. Hyperphosphorylation on
CC       Ser-103 in response to DNA damage has no effect on transcriptional
CC       activity. MAPK1/MAPK3-mediated phosphorylation on Thr-455 and Thr-
CC       738 enhances VEGF transcription but, represses FGF2-triggered
CC       PDGFR-alpha transcription. Also implicated in the repression of
CC       RECK by ERBB2. Hyperphosphorylated on Thr-280 and Thr-738 during
CC       mitosis by MAPK8 shielding SP1 from degradation by the ubiquitin-
CC       dependent pathway. Phosphorylated in the zinc-finger domain by
CC       calmodulin-activated PKCzeta. Phosphorylation on Ser-642 by
CC       PKCzeta is critical for TSA-activated LHR gene expression through
CC       release of its repressor, p107. Phosphorylation on Thr-669, Ser-
CC       671 and Thr-682 is stimulated by angiotensin II via the AT1
CC       receptor inducing increased binding to the PDGF-D promoter. This
CC       phosphorylation is increased in injured artey wall. Ser-61 and
CC       Thr-682 can both be dephosphorylated by PP2A during cell-cycle
CC       interphase. Dephosphorylation on Ser-61 leads to increased
CC       chromatin association during interphase and increases the
CC       transcriptional activity. On insulin stimulation, sequentially
CC       glycosylated and phosphorylated on several C-terminal serine and
CC       threonine residues (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Acetylated. Acetylation/deacetylation events affect
CC       transcriptional activity. Deacetylation leads to an increase in
CC       the expression the 12(s)-lipooxygenase gene though recruitment of
CC       p300 to the promoter (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated. Ubiquitination occurs on the C-terminal
CC       proteolytically-cleaved peptide and is triggered by
CC       phosphorylation (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylated with SUMO1. Sumoylation modulates proteolytic
CC       cleavage of the N-terminal repressor domain. Sumoylation levels
CC       are attenuated during tumorigenesis. Phosphorylation mediates SP1
CC       desumoylation (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Proteolytic cleavage in the N-terminal repressor domain is
CC       prevented by sumoylation. The C-terminal cleaved product is
CC       susceptible to degradation (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: O-glycosylated; Contains 8 N-acetylglucosamine side chains.
CC       Levels are controlled by insulin and the SP1 phosphorylation
CC       states. Insulin-mediated O-glycosylation locates SP1 to the
CC       nucleus, where it is sequentially deglycosylated and
CC       phosphorylated. O-glycosylation affects transcriptional activity
CC       through disrupting the interaction with a number of transcription
CC       factors including ELF1 and NFYA. Inhibited by peroxisomome
CC       proliferator receptor gamma (PPARgamma) (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the Sp1 C2H2-type zinc-finger protein
CC       family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 3 C2H2-type zinc fingers.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00042}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Cytoskeletal linker protein. May promote and stabilize
CC       the formation of the actin and microtubule network (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts (via CH domain) with F-actin. Interacts (via C
CC       terminus) with microtubules (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton {ECO:0000250}. Note=Localizes to microtubule and
CC       actin cytoskeletons. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The GAR domain modulates the binding strength to each
CC       cytoskeletal network. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the GAS2 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: TAFs are components of the transcription factor IID
CC       (TFIID) complex, PCAF histone acetylase complex and TBP-free TAFII
CC       complex (TFTC). TIIFD is multimeric protein complex that plays a
CC       central role in mediating promoter responses to various activators
CC       and repressors (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: TFIID and PCAF are composed of TATA binding protein (TBP)
CC       and a number of TBP-associated factors (TAFs). TBP is not part of
CC       TFTC. Interacts directly with TBP, TAF1/TAFII250, TAF9/TAFII31 AND
CC       TAF12/TAFII20. The TAF6/TAFII70-TAF9/TAFII31 heterodimer forms an
CC       octamer complex with the TAF4B/TFII105-TAF12/TFIID20 heterodimer.
CC       Also interacts with the GTFs, TFIIEalpha/GTF2E1 and
CC       TFIIFalpha/GTF2F1. Component of the TFTC-HAT complex. Component of
CC       some MLL1/MLL complex, at least composed of the core components
CC       KMT2A/MLL1, ASH2L, HCFC1/HCF1, WDR5 and RBBP5, as well as the
CC       facultative components BAP18, CHD8, E2F6, HSP70, INO80C, KANSL1,
CC       LAS1L, MAX, MCRS1, MGA, MYST1/MOF, PELP1, PHF20, PRP31, RING2,

RP   FUNCTION, INTERACTION WITH MDM2, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND MUTAGENESIS
RP   OF GLY-256.
RX   PubMed=21132010; DOI=10.1038/onc.2010.550;
RA   Meng L., Hsu J.K., Tsai R.Y.;
RT   "GNL3L depletion destabilizes MDM2 and induces p53-dependent G2/M
RT   arrest.";
RL   Oncogene 30:1716-1726(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: May be required to maintain the proliferative capacity
CC       of stem cells (By similarity). Stabilizes MDM2 by preventing its
CC       ubiquitination, and hence proteasomal degradation. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21132010}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with MDM2; this interaction stabilizes MDM2.
CC       Interaction with MDM2 occurs in the nucleoplasm and is triggered
CC       by a nucleolar release mechanism, such as mitosis-induced
CC       nucleolar disassembly. Indirectly interacts with TP53, via MDM2-
CC       binding (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleolus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Shuttles between the nucleus and nucleolus.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Long;
CC         IsoId=Q8CI11-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Short;
CC         IsoId=Q8CI11-2; Sequence=VSP_013412;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in the adult bone marrow population
CC       that is enriched in hematopoietic stem cells.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12464630}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed at E8.5 and E10.5 in the cerebral
CC       cortex; expression declines rapidly from this point.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12464630}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The basic domain (B) allows nucleolar localization in the
CC       absence of GTP. The intermediate domain (I) inhibits nucleolar
CC       localization by the B domain and is required for exit from the
CC       nucleolus. Exit from the nucleolus to the nucleoplasm requires
CC       both the I and the acidic (A) domains, and may be triggered by GTP
CC       hydrolysis (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: In contrast to other GTP-binding proteins, this family is
CC       characterized by a circular permutation of the GTPase motifs
CC       described by a G4-G1-G3 pattern.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TRAFAC class YlqF/YawG GTPase family.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01058}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 CP-type G (guanine nucleotide-binding)
CC       domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU01058}.

RP   INTERACTION WITH ACY1.
RX   PubMed=15196915; DOI=10.1016/j.febslet.2004.04.093;
RA   Maceyka M., Nava V.E., Milstien S., Spiegel S.;
RT   "Aminoacylase 1 is a sphingosine kinase 1-interacting protein.";
RL   FEBS Lett. 568:30-34(2004).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the phosphorylation of sphingosine to form
CC       sphingosine 1-phosphate (SPP), a lipid mediator with both intra-
CC       and extracellular functions. Also acts on D-erythro-sphingosine
CC       and to a lesser extent sphinganine, but not other lipids, such as
CC       D,L-threo-dihydrosphingosine, N,N-dimethylsphingosine,
CC       diacylglycerol, ceramide, or phosphatidylinositol (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + sphinganine = ADP + sphinganine 1-
CC       phosphate.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + sphingosine = ADP + sphingosine 1-
CC       phosphate.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Binds to calmodulin. Interacts with SPHKAP. Interacts
CC       with CIB1, the interaction occurs in a calcium-dependent manner
CC       (By similarity). Interacts with ACY1. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:15196915}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cell membrane {ECO:0000250}. Note=Translocated from
CC       the cytoplasm to the plasma membrane in a CIB1-dependent manner.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=3;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q8CI15-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q8CI15-2; Sequence=VSP_033448;
CC       Name=3;
CC         IsoId=Q8CI15-3; Sequence=VSP_033449;
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: Sphingosine 1-phosphate stimulates TRAF2 E3
CC       ubiquitin ligase activity, and promotes activation of NF-kappa-B
CC       in response to TNF signaling. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 DAGKc domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00783}.

RN   [17]
RP   FUNCTION, AND INTERACTION WITH AICDA.
RX   PubMed=21518874; DOI=10.1073/pnas.1104423108;
RA   Okazaki I.M., Okawa K., Kobayashi M., Yoshikawa K., Kawamoto S.,
RA   Nagaoka H., Shinkura R., Kitawaki Y., Taniguchi H., Natsume T.,

RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;

RP   IDENTIFIACTION IN A LARGE PER COMPLEX.
RX   PubMed=24413057; DOI=10.1038/nsmb.2746;
RA   Duong H.A., Weitz C.J.;

RT   clock Period complexes.";

RN   [20]
RP   CITRULLINATION AT ARG-470 AND ARG-472.
RX   PubMed=24463520; DOI=10.1038/nature12942;
RA   Christophorou M.A., Castelo-Branco G., Halley-Stott R.P.,
RA   Oliveira C.S., Loos R., Radzisheuskaya A., Mowen K.A., Bertone P.,
RA   Silva J.C., Zernicka-Goetz M., Nielsen M.L., Gurdon J.B.,
RA   Kouzarides T.;
RT   "Citrullination regulates pluripotency and histone H1 binding to
RT   chromatin.";
RL   Nature 507:104-108(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Nuclear corepressor for KRAB domain-containing zinc
CC       finger proteins (KRAB-ZFPs). Mediates gene silencing by recruiting
CC       CHD3, a subunit of the nucleosome remodeling and deacetylation
CC       (NuRD) complex, and SETDB1 (which specifically methylates histone
CC       H3 at 'Lys-9' (H3K9me)) to the promoter regions of KRAB target
CC       genes. Enhances transcriptional repression by coordinating the
CC       increase in H3K9me, the decrease in histone H3 'Lys-9 and 'Lys-14'
CC       acetylation (H3K9ac and H3K14ac, respectively) and the disposition
CC       of HP1 proteins to silence gene expression. Recruitment of SETDB1
CC       induces heterochromatinization. May play a role as a coactivator
CC       for CEBPB and NR3C1 in the transcriptional activation of ORM1.
CC       Also corepressor for ERBB4. Inhibits E2F1 activity by stimulating
CC       E2F1-HDAC1 complex formation and inhibiting E2F1 acetylation. May
CC       serve as a partial backup to prevent E2F1-mediated apoptosis in
CC       the absence of RB1. Important regulator of CDKN1A/p21(CIP1). Has
CC       E3 SUMO-protein ligase activity toward itself via its PHD-type
CC       zinc finger. Specifically sumoylates IRF7, thereby inhibiting its
CC       transactivation activity. Ubiquitinates p53/TP53 leading to its
CC       proteosomal degradation; the function is enhanced by MAGEC2 and
CC       MAGEA2, and possibly MAGEA3 and MAGEA6. Mediates the nuclear
CC       localization of KOX1, ZNF268 and ZNF300 transcription factors (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PATHWAY: Protein modification; protein sumoylation.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Oligomer; the RBCC domain homotrimerizes and interacts
CC       with one molecule of KRAB to form the KRAB-KAP1 corepressor
CC       complex. Interacts with SETX (By similarity). Binding to a KRAB
CC       domain is an absolute requirement for silencing gene expression.
CC       Interacts with a number of KRAB-ZFP proteins including ZNF10,
CC       ZFP53, ZFP68, ZNF382 and ZNF256. Interacts with NCOR1, NR3C1 and
CC       CHD3. Interacts with CEBPB (via the RING-type and PHD-type zinc
CC       fingers). Interacts with CBX5 (via the PxVxL motif); the
CC       interaction occurs in interphase nuclei and competes for binding
CC       POGZ. Interacts with POGZ; the interaction competes for
CC       interaction with CBX5. Interacts with SETDB1; the interaction is
CC       enhanced by KAP1 sumoylation, stimulates SETB1 histone
CC       methyltransferase activity and gene silencing. Interacts (via the
CC       PHD-type zinc finger) with UBE2I; the interaction is required for
CC       sumoylation and repressor activity. Component of the TRIM28/KAP1-
CC       ERBB4-MDM2 complex involved in connecting growth factor and DNA
CC       damage responses. Interacts directly with ERBB4; the interaction
CC       represses ERBB4-mediated transcription activity. Interacts with
CC       MDM2; the interaction contributes to p53/TP53 inactivation.
CC       Component of the TRIM28/KAP1-MDM2-p53/TP53; involved in regulating
CC       p53/TP53 stabilization and activity. Interacts (via the leucine
CC       zipper alpha helical coiled-coil) with E2F1 (central region); the
CC       interaction inhibits E2F1 acetylation and transcriptional
CC       activity. Interacts with PPP1CA; the interaction dephosphorylates
CC       TRIM28 at Ser-824 and forms a complex at the p21 promoter site.
CC       Interacts with PPP1CB; the interaction is weak but is increased on
CC       dephosphorylation at Ser-824. Interacts with CEBPB and NR3C1.
CC       Interacts with CBX5 (via the PxVxL motif); the interaction occurs
CC       in interphase nuclei and competes for binding POGZ. Component of a
CC       ternary complex that includes TRIM28, a HP1 protein (CBX1, CBX3 OR
CC       CBX5), a KRAB domain-containing protein, and DNA. Interacts with
CC       SMARCAD1. Interacts with, and sumoylates IRF7. Interacts with
CC       MAGEC2. Part of a complex composed of TRIM28, HDAC1, HDAC2 and
CC       EHMT2. Interacts (via the RBCC domain) with KOX1 (via the KRAB
CC       domain), ZNF268 (via the KRAB domain) and ZNF300 (via the KRAB
CC       domain); the interactions increase KOX1, ZNF268 and ZNF300 nuclear
CC       localization activities. Interacts with AICDA. The large PER
CC       complex involved in the histone methylation is composed of at
CC       least PER2, CBX3, TRIM28, SUV39H1 and/or SUV39H2; CBX3 mediates
CC       the formation of the complex. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q13263,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10330177, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10562550,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11154279, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21518874,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9742105}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10330177,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:11154279, ECO:0000269|PubMed:12154074}.
CC       Note=Associated with centromeric heterochromatin during cell
CC       differentiation through CBX1.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q62318-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q62318-2; Sequence=VSP_010899, VSP_010900;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The HP1 box is both necessary and sufficient for HP1
CC       binding. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The PHD-type zinc finger enhances CEBPB transcriptional
CC       activity. The PHD-type zinc finger, the HP1 box and the bromo
CC       domain, function together to assemble the machinery required for
CC       repression of KRAB domain-containing proteins. Acts as an
CC       intramolecular SUMO E3 ligase for autosumoylation of bromodomain
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The RING-finger-B Box-coiled-coil/tripartite motif
CC       (RBCC/TRIM motif) is required for interaction with the KRAB domain
CC       of KRAB-zinc finger proteins. Binds four zinc ions per molecule.
CC       The RING finger and the N-terminal of the leucine zipper alpha
CC       helical coiled-coil region of RBCC are required for
CC       oligomerization (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Contains one Pro-Xaa-Val-Xaa-Leu (PxVxL) motif, which is
CC       required for interaction with chromoshadow domains. This motif
CC       requires additional residues -7, -6, +4 and +5 of the central Val
CC       which contact the chromoshadow domain (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: ATM-induced phosphorylation on Ser-824 represses sumoylation
CC       leading to the de-repression of expression of a subset of genes
CC       involved in cell cycle control and apoptosis in response to
CC       genotoxic stress. Dephosphorylation by the phosphatases, PPP1CA
CC       and PP1CB forms, allows sumoylation and expression of TRIM28
CC       target genes (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylation/desumoylation events regulate TRIM28-mediated
CC       transcriptional repression. Sumoylation is required for
CC       interaction with CHD3 and SETDB1 and the corepressor activity.
CC       Represses and is repressed by Ser-824 phosphorylation. Enhances
CC       the TRIM28 corepressor activity, inhibiting transcriptional
CC       activity of a number of genes including GADD45A and CDKN1A/p21.
CC       Lys-554, Lys-779 and Lys-804 are the major sites of sumoylation.
CC       In response to Dox-induced DNA damage, enhanced phosphorylation on
CC       Ser-824 prevents sumoylation and allows de-repression of
CC       CDKN1A/p21 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Auto-ubiquitinated; enhanced by MAGEA2 and MAGEC2.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Citrullinated by PADI4. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24463520}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TRIM/RBCC family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 B box-type zinc fingers.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00024}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 bromo domain. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PHD-type zinc finger. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00146}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 RING-type zinc finger.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00175}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Suppresses cell growth when expressed ectopically.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19654412}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19654412}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highest expression observed in spleen and
CC       thymus with moderate levels in bone marrow, lung, skin and heart,
CC       low levels in muscle, liver and intestine and little or no
CC       expression in brain and pancreas. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19654412}.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By interferon-alpha and interferon-beta.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19654412}.
CC   -!- POLYMORPHISM: This gene is present in strains 129/J, 129/SvJ,
CC       BALB/cAn, BALB/cJ, BALB/cHeA, CBA/N, C3H/HeJ, C3H/HeN, C57BL/6J,
CC       C57BL/10SnJ, C57L/J, NOD and NZW/LacJ but is absent in strains
CC       129S6/SvEvTac, AKR/N, A/J, DBA/2J, NON, NZB/BlNJ, P/J, SENCARA/Pt,
CC       SWR/J and STS/A. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19654412}.

RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, AND TISSUE SPECIFICITY.
RX   PubMed=24970816;
RA   Liu J., Xu D., Wang H., Zhang Y., Chang Y., Zhang J., Wang J., Li C.,
RA   Liu H., Zhao M., Lin C., Zhan Q., Huang C., Qian H.;
RT   "The subcellular distribution and function of MTA1 in cancer
RT   differentiation.";
RL   Oncotarget 5:5153-5164(2014).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Transcriptional coregulator which can act as both a
CC       transcriptional corepressor and coactivator. As a part of the
CC       histone-deacetylase multiprotein complex (NuRD), regulates
CC       transcription of its targets by modifying the acetylation status
CC       of the target chromatin and cofactor accessibility to the target
CC       DNA. In conjunction with other components of NuRD, acts as a
CC       transcriptional corepressor of BRCA1, ESR1, TFF1 and CDKN1A. Acts
CC       as a transcriptional coactivator of BCAS3, PAX5 and SUMO2,
CC       independent of the NuRD complex. Stimulates the expression of WNT1
CC       by inhibiting the expression of its transcriptional corepressor
CC       SIX3. Plays a role in the inflammatory responses, both as a target
CC       and as a component of the NF-kappa-B signaling and regulates a
CC       subset of proinflammatory cytokines such as IL1B, MIP2, and TNF.
CC       Regulates p53-dependent and -independent DNA repair processes
CC       following genotoxic stress. Regulates the stability and function
CC       of p53/TP53 by inhibiting its ubiquitination by COP1 and MDM2
CC       thereby regulating the p53-dependent DNA repair. Plays an
CC       important role in tumorigenesis, tumor invasion, and metastasis.
CC       Plays a role in the regulation of the circadian clock and is
CC       essential for the generation and maintenance of circadian rhythms
CC       under constant light and for normal entrainment of behavior to
CC       light-dark (LD) cycles. Positively regulates the CLOCK-ARNTL/BMAL1
CC       heterodimer mediated transcriptional activation of its own
CC       transcription and the transcription of CRY1. Regulates
CC       deacetylation of ARNTL/BMAL1 by regulating SIRT1 expression,
CC       resulting in derepressing CRY1-mediated transcription repression.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17671180, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19805145,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19837670, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20071335,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20519513, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20682799,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21965678, ECO:0000269|PubMed:24089055}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the nucleosome-remodeling and histone-
CC       deacetylase multiprotein complex (NuRD). Interacts with HDAC1 and
CC       ITGB3BP/CENPR (By similarity). Binds to CSNK1G2 in the cytoplasm.
CC       Interacts with NACC2. Interacts with EP300, TFAP2C, IFI16, TPR,
CC       UBE2I/UBC9, PIAS1, PIAS3, PIAS4, MDM2, RFWD2, SUMO1, SUMO2, SENP1
CC       and SENP2 (By similarity). Interacts with ARNTL/BMAL1 and CLOCK.
CC       Interacts with p53/TP53 and HDAC2. Interacts with SIX3;
CC       facilitates the binding of SIX3 to the core DNA motif of SIX3
CC       promoter. {ECO:0000250, ECO:0000269|PubMed:15077195,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:17666527, ECO:0000269|PubMed:19837670,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:20519513, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20682799,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24089055}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus. Nucleus envelope
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00512, ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00624}. Cytoplasm. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Associated with microtubules. Primarily
CC       localized in the cytoplasm in embryonic tissues. Localization at
CC       the nuclear envelope is TPR-dependent.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Widely expressed but not in skeletal muscle.
CC       Highly expressed in the brain, liver, kidney and cardiac muscle
CC       and in mammary tumors. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16617102,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24970816}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expressed at high levels in embryonic nerve
CC       tissues, such as the brain, eyes, and spinal cord.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: By lipopolyssacharide (LPS).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20519513}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation by CSNK1G2/CK1 triggered by estrogen enhances
CC       corepression of estrogen receptor (ER).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15077195}.
CC   -!- PTM: Acetylation is essential for its transcriptional coactivator
CC       activity. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylation positively regulates its transcriptional
CC       corepressor activity but does not affect the protein stability.
CC       Sumoylated preferentially by SUMO2 or SUMO3 than SUMO1.
CC       Sumoylation is enhanced by PIAS1/3/4 and preferentially sumoylated
CC       by SUMO2 in the presence of PIAS1/3/4. Desumoylated by SENP1 (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated by RFWD2, which leads to proteasomal
CC       degradation. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Mice exhibit a disruption of the free-
CC       running period of circadian rhythms under constant light and
CC       normal entrainment of behavior to light-dark (LD) cycles.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:24089055}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 BAH domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00370}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 ELM2 domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00512}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 GATA-type zinc finger. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 SANT domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00624}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAC57413.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

AC   Q8C033; Q5DU38; Q80VH8; Q8BW76; Q922S7;
DT   05-JUL-2004, integrated into UniProtKB/Swiss-Prot.
DT   27-JUN-2006, sequence version 2.

CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Ubiquitously expressed.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14508709}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Found in the neuroepithelium of the meninges
CC       at E8.5, and in the roof plate of the rhombencephalon at E9.5. In
CC       E12.5 embryos, it is ubiquitously expressed, with a pronounced
CC       expression in the neuroepithelium of brain vesicles, the neural
CC       tube, the ganglia and the neural layer of the retina.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:14508709}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May be involved in intracellular vesicle traffic and
CC       potentially in calcium-dependent exocytosis in neuroendocrine
CC       cells. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Binds to the C-terminal coiled coil region of syntaxin
CC       family members STX1A, STX3A and STX4A, but not when these proteins
CC       are complexed with SNAP25, VAMP2 or STXBP1, suggesting that it
CC       interacts with syntaxins that do not form the SNARE complex.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Calcium-dependent, calmodulin-stimulated protein
CC       phosphatase. This subunit may have a role in the calmodulin
CC       activation of calcineurin.

RP   INTERACTION WITH NUDT21.
RX   PubMed=11716503; DOI=10.1006/bbrc.2001.5992;
RA   Kim H., Lee Y.;
RT   "Interaction of poly(A) polymerase with the 25-kDa subunit of cleavage
RT   factor I.";
RL   Biochem. Biophys. Res. Commun. 289:513-518(2001).
RN   [4]
RP   SUMOYLATION AT LYS-444; LYS-445; LYS-506; LYS-507; LYS-730 AND
RP   LYS-734, SUBCELLULAR LOCATION, TISSUE SPECIFICITY, FUNCTION, AND
RP   MUTAGENESIS OF 444-LYS-LYS-445; 506-LYS-LYS-507 AND 656-LYS-LYS-657.
RX   PubMed=18281463; DOI=10.1101/gad.1628208;
RA   Vethantham V., Rao N., Manley J.L.;
RT   "Sumoylation regulates multiple aspects of mammalian poly(A)
RT   polymerase function.";
RL   Genes Dev. 22:499-511(2008).
RN   [5]
RP   PHOSPHORYLATION AT SER-537, FUNCTION, IDENTIFICATION BY MASS
RP   SPECTROMETRY, AND MUTAGENESIS OF SER-537.
RX   PubMed=18084034; DOI=10.1093/nar/gkm1091;
RA   Lee S.-H., Choi H.-S., Kim H., Lee Y.;
RT   "ERK is a novel regulatory kinase for poly(A) polymerase.";
RL   Nucleic Acids Res. 36:803-813(2008).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Polymerase that creates the 3'-poly(A) tail of mRNA's.
CC       Also required for the endoribonucleolytic cleavage reaction at
CC       some polyadenylation sites. May acquire specificity through
CC       interaction with a cleavage and polyadenylation specificity factor
CC       (CPSF) at its C-terminus (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + RNA(n) = diphosphate + RNA(n+1).
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Name=Mn(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29035; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 2 magnesium ions. Also active with manganese.
CC       {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer. Found in a complex with CPSF1, FIP1L1 and
CC       PAPOLA. Interacts with FIP1L1 (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       NUDT21; the interaction is diminished by acetylation. Interacts
CC       with KPNB1; the interaction promotes PAP nuclear import and is
CC       inhibited by acetylation of PAP (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q61183-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=III;
CC         IsoId=Q61183-2; Sequence=VSP_004531, VSP_004532;
CC       Name=3; Synonyms=V;
CC         IsoId=Q61183-3; Sequence=VSP_004529, VSP_004530;
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=VI;
CC         IsoId=Q61183-4; Sequence=VSP_004527, VSP_004528;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in brain, thymus, lung, kidney,
CC       bladder, testis and spleen. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18281463}.
CC   -!- PTM: Polysumoylated. Varying sumolyation depending on tissue- and
CC       cell-type. Highly sumoylated in bladder and NIH 3T3 cells.
CC       Sumoylation is required for nuclear localization and enhances PAP
CC       stability. Desumoylated by SENP1. Inhibits polymerase activity.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:18281463}.
CC   -!- PTM: Hyperphosphorylation on multiple CDK2 consensus and non-
CC       consensus sites in the C-terminal Ser/Thr-rich region represses
CC       PAP activity in late M-phase. Phosphorylation/dephosphorylation
CC       may regulate the interaction between PAP and CPSF (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Acetylated in the C-terminus. Acetylation decreases
CC       interaction with NUDT21 and KPNB1, and inhibits nuclear
CC       localization through inhibiting binding to the importin alpha/beta
CC       complex (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the poly(A) polymerase family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Transcriptional regulator that associates with ribosomal
CC       RNA promoters and suppresses ribosomal RNA (rRNA) transcription.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with UBTF. Interacts with the NuRD complex
CC       component RBBP4 (via the nucleolar localization motif), the
CC       interaction mediates transcriptional repression activity (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, nucleolus
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Chromosome, centromere, kinetochore
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q8IWS0}. Note=Nuclear, it particularly
CC       localizes to the nucleolus. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9D4J7-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9D4J7-2; Sequence=VSP_009375;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: At 12.5 dpc it is highly expressed in the
CC       embryonic central nervous system and at lower levels in other
CC       tissues. Very low levels present throughout the adult brain.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12415272}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: Expression is high in the embryonic and early
CC       postnatal stages. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12415272}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The PHD-type zinc finger 1 mediates both nucleolar
CC       localization and interaction with UBTF. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The ePHD2 domain folds as an integrated structural module
CC       comprizing the C2HC-type zinc finger (pre-PHD) and the atypical
CC       PHD-type 2 zinc finger. It mediates non-specific binding to dsDNA,
CC       but doesn't bind histones in contrast to many PHD-type zinc
CC       fingers (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 C2HC-type zinc fingers. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 PHD-type zinc fingers. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Single-stranded nucleic acid binding protein that binds
CC       preferentially to oligo dC. Major cellular poly(rC)-binding
CC       protein. Binds also poly(rU). Negatively regulates cellular
CC       antiviral responses mediated by MAVS signaling. It acts as an
CC       adapter between MAVS and the E3 ubiquitin ligase ITCH, therefore
CC       triggering MAVS ubiquitinationa and degradation (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Identified in a mRNP complex, at least composed of DHX9,
CC       DDX3X, ELAVL1, HNRNPU, IGF2BP1, ILF3, PABPC1, PCBP2, PTBP2, STAU1,
CC       STAU2, SYNCRIP and YBX1. Interacts with IFIH1 and RNF135 (By
CC       similarity). Interacts with MAVS (via C-terminus) and ITCH (via WW
CC       domains) (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:

RX   PubMed=23443664; DOI=10.1074/jbc.M112.445692;
RA   Zmrzljak U.P., Korencic A., Kosir R., Golicnik M., Sassone-Corsi P.,
RA   Rozman D.;
RT   "Inducible cAMP early repressor regulates the Period 1 gene of the
RT   hepatic and adrenal clocks.";
RL   J. Biol. Chem. 288:10318-10327(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Transcriptional regulator that binds the cAMP response
CC       element (CRE), a sequence present in many viral and cellular
CC       promoters. Isoforms are either transcriptional activators or
CC       repressors. Isoform 2, isoform 3 and isoform 4 are repressors,
CC       while isoform 1 is an activator. Plays a role in spermatogenesis
CC       and is involved in spermatid maturation. Binding of isoform 1
CC       (activator) to CRE is increased by CREB3L4. The CREM isoform 1-
CC       CREB3L4 heterodimer functions through CRE and may recruit HIRA to
CC       CRE to regulate histone exchange (PubMed:16595651).
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16595651}.
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Isoform 11: Plays a role in the regulation of the
CC       circadian clock: acts as a transcriptional repressor of the core
CC       circadian component PER1 by directly binding to cAMP response
CC       elements in its promoter. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16595651,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:23443664}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Binds DNA as a dimer (By similarity). Interacts with
CC       CDC34 (By similarity). Interacts with FHL5. Isoform 1 forms a
CC       heterodimer with CREB3L4. {ECO:0000250,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10086359, ECO:0000269|PubMed:16595651}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O09106:Hdac1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-8744406, EBI-301912;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23443664,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8252624}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform 11: Cytoplasm. Nucleus.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative promoter usage, Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=11;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=CREM-BCEFGgammaHIbeta, Tau;
CC         IsoId=P27699-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Alpha;
CC         IsoId=P27699-2; Sequence=VSP_000602, VSP_000603, VSP_000604,
CC                                  VSP_000607;
CC       Name=3; Synonyms=Beta;
CC         IsoId=P27699-3; Sequence=VSP_000602, VSP_000603, VSP_000604;
CC       Name=4; Synonyms=Gamma;
CC         IsoId=P27699-4; Sequence=VSP_000602, VSP_000605, VSP_000606;
CC       Name=5; Synonyms=Tau Alpha Gamma;
CC         IsoId=P27699-5; Sequence=VSP_038016, VSP_000607;
CC       Name=6; Synonyms=Tau 2 Alpha;
CC         IsoId=P27699-6; Sequence=VSP_000602, VSP_000607;
CC       Name=7; Synonyms=Tau 1 Alpha;
CC         IsoId=P27699-7; Sequence=VSP_000603, VSP_000604, VSP_000607;
CC       Name=8; Synonyms=Tau 1 Alpha Gamma;
CC         IsoId=P27699-8; Sequence=VSP_000605, VSP_000606, VSP_000607;
CC       Name=9; Synonyms=Tau 1 Gamma;
CC         IsoId=P27699-9; Sequence=VSP_000605, VSP_000606;
CC       Name=10; Synonyms=Alpha Gamma;
CC         IsoId=P27699-10; Sequence=VSP_000602, VSP_000605, VSP_000606,
CC                                   VSP_000607;
CC       Name=11; Synonyms=Icer Gamma;
CC         IsoId=P27699-11; Sequence=VSP_055987, VSP_000607;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative promoter usage.;
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: In premeiotic germ cells, expressed at low
CC       amounts in the antagonist form. Subsequently, during
CC       spermatogenesis, isoform 1 (activator) is generated exclusively
CC       and in extremely high amounts.
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Isoform 11 is expressed in a circadian manner in the
CC       adrenal gland with an expression peak at ZT20 (at protein level).
CC       It is induced by cAMP in an immediate-early fashion and can
CC       repress its own production via a negative autoregulatory
CC       mechanism. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:23443664,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8252624}.
CC   -!- PTM: Stimulated by phosphorylation. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated by CDC34 and RAD6B in order to be degraded by
CC       the proteasome. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: CREM-null deficient mice display male infertility:
CC       while spermatogonia differentiate normally into round spermatids,
CC       all the elongating spermatids are eliminated by apoptosis during
CC       spermiogenesis.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the bZIP family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 bZIP (basic-leucine zipper) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00978}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 KID (kinase-inducible) domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00312}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=AAA17495.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=AAA17496.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=AAA17497.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=AAV28551.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=AAV28552.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=AAV28553.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};
CC       Sequence=AAV28554.1; Type=Erroneous initiation; Note=Translation N-terminally extended.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Proteolytically removes the C-terminal three residues of
CC       farnesylated proteins. Acts on lamin A/C.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11923874}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: The peptide bond hydrolyzed can be designated

CC       protein, and may be any of several amino acids.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Required for cytokinesis (By similarity). Essential for
CC       the structural integrity of the cleavage furrow and for completion
CC       of cleavage furrow ingression (By similarity). May play a
CC       significant role in podocyte cell migration (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9NQW6}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with F-actin. Interacts with CD2AP. May
CC       interact with RHOA. Interacts with FZR1/CDH1 during mitotic exit
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm,
CC       cytoskeleton {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm, cell cortex {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Mainly found in the nucleus during interphase. Colocalizes
CC       with cortical F-actin upon nuclear envelope breakdown in mitosis
CC       and subsequently concentrates in the area of the prospective
CC       contractile ring in anaphase. This pattern persists until
CC       telophase, when the protein becomes concentrated in the midbody.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated during mitosis. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated, and this requires FZR1/CDH1. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 PH domain. {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-
CC       ProRule:PRU00145}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Catalyzes the NADPH-dependent reduction of several
CC       pentoses, tetroses, trioses, alpha-dicarbonyl compounds and L-
CC       xylulose. Participates in the uronate cycle of glucose metabolism.
CC       May play a role in the water absorption and cellular
CC       osmoregulation in the proximal renal tubules by producing xylitol,
CC       an osmolyte, thereby preventing osmolytic stress from occurring in
CC       the renal tubules.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Xylitol + NADP(+) = L-xylulose + NADPH.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11882650}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homotetramer.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral membrane
CC       protein {ECO:0000250}. Apical cell membrane
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11882650}; Peripheral membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11882650}. Note=Probably recruited to
CC       membranes via an interaction with phosphatidylinositol (By
CC       similarity). In kidney, it is localized in the brush border
CC       membranes of proximal tubular cells. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Highly expressed in kidney, liver and
CC       epididymis. Expressed at intermediate level in lung. Weakly or not
CC       expressed in brain, heart, spleen and testis.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11882650}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the short-chain dehydrogenases/reductases
CC       (SDR) family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Essential for RNA polymerase III to make a number of
CC       small nuclear and cytoplasmic RNAs, including 5S RNA, tRNA, and
CC       adenovirus-associated (VA) RNA of both cellular and viral origin.
CC       Has histone acetyltransferase activity (HAT) with unique
CC       specificity for free and nucleosomal H3. May cooperate with GTF3C5
CC       in facilitating the recruitment of TFIIIB and RNA polymerase
CC       through direct interactions with BRF1, POLR3C and POLR3F. May be
CC       localized close to the A box (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Acetyl-CoA + [histone] = CoA + acetyl-
CC       [histone].
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Part of the TFIIIC subcomplex TFIIIC2, consisting of six
CC       subunits, GTF3C1, GTF3C2, GTF3C3, GTF3C4, GTF3C5 and GTF3C6.
CC       Interacts with BRF1, GTF3C1, GTF3C2, GTF3C5, GTF3C6, POLR3C and
CC       POLR3F (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.

CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the TFIIIC subunit 4 family. {ECO:0000305}.

RP   NUCLEOTIDE SEQUENCE [LARGE SCALE MRNA] (ISOFORM 1).
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Non-catalytic component of the RNA exosome complex which
CC       has 3'->5' exoribonuclease activity and participates in a
CC       multitude of cellular RNA processing and degradation events. In
CC       the nucleus, the RNA exosome complex is involved in proper
CC       maturation of stable RNA species such as rRNA, snRNA and snoRNA,
CC       in the elimination of RNA processing by-products and non-coding
CC       'pervasive' transcripts, such as antisense RNA species and
CC       promoter-upstream transcripts (PROMPTs), and of mRNAs with
CC       processing defects, thereby limiting or excluding their export to
CC       the cytoplasm. The RNA exosome may be involved in Ig class switch
CC       recombination (CSR) and/or Ig variable region somatic
CC       hypermutation (SHM) by targeting AICDA deamination activity to
CC       transcribed dsDNA substrates. In the cytoplasm, the RNA exosome
CC       complex is involved in general mRNA turnover and specifically
CC       degrades inherently unstable mRNAs containing AU-rich elements
CC       (AREs) within their 3' untranslated regions, and in RNA
CC       surveillance pathways, preventing translation of aberrant mRNAs.
CC       It seems to be involved in degradation of histone mRNA. The
CC       catalytic inactive RNA exosome core complex of 9 subunits (Exo-9)
CC       is proposed to play a pivotal role in the binding and presentation
CC       of RNA for ribonucleolysis, and to serve as a scaffold for the
CC       association with catalytic subunits and accessory proteins or
CC       complexes. EXOSC1 as peripheral part of the Exo-9 complex
CC       stabilizes the hexameric ring of RNase PH-domain subunits through
CC       contacts with EXOSC6 and EXOSC8 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the RNA exosome complex. Specifically part
CC       of the catalytically inactive RNA exosome core (Exo-9) complex
CC       which is believed to associate with catalytic subunits EXOSC10,
CC       and DIS3 or DIS3L in cytoplasmic- and nuclear-specific RNA exosome
CC       complex forms. Exo-9 is formed by a hexameric ring of RNase PH
CC       domain-containing subunits specifically containing the
CC       heterodimers EXOSC4-EXOSC9, EXOSC5-EXOSC8 and EXOSC6-EXOSC7, and
CC       peripheral S1 domain-containing components EXOSC1, EXOSC2 and
CC       EXOSC3 located on the top of the ring structure. Interacts with
CC       EXOSC5, EXOSC7 and EXOSC10 (By similarity). Interacts with DDX60
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nucleolus. Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q9DAA6-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q9DAA6-2; Sequence=VSP_004176;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the CSL4 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 S1 motif domain. {ECO:0000305}.

RC   TISSUE=Liver;
RX   PubMed=17242355; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0609836104;
RA   Villen J., Beausoleil S.A., Gerber S.A., Gygi S.P.;
RT   "Large-scale phosphorylation analysis of mouse liver.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 104:1488-1493(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Assembly protein recruiting clathrin and adapter protein
CC       complex 2 (AP2) to cell membranes at sites of coated-pit formation
CC       and clathrin-vesicle assembly. May be required to determine the
CC       amount of membrane to be recycled, possibly by regulating the size
CC       of the clathrin cage. Involved in AP2-dependent clathrin-mediated
CC       endocytosis at the neuromuscular junction. Plays a crucial role in
CC       fetal and adult hematopoiesis, and normal prenatal and postnatal
CC       growth and viability. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:12832620,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9292517}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Binds clathrin and phosphatidylinositol 4,5-bisphosphate.
CC       Interacts with FAM64A; this interaction may change the subcellular
CC       location into the nucleus. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Membrane, clathrin-coated pit {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Golgi apparatus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasmic vesicle, clathrin-
CC       coated vesicle {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Colocalized with clathrin in the Golgi area. Interaction with
CC       FAM64A may target PICALM to the nucleus in some cells.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.

RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Brain;
RX   PubMed=16452087; DOI=10.1074/mcp.T500041-MCP200;

RN   [7]
RP   FUNCTION, AND INTERACTION WITH HDAC1 AND HDAC4.
RX   PubMed=21590736; DOI=10.1002/jbmr.426;
RA   Kim H.N., Lee J.H., Bae S.C., Ryoo H.M., Kim H.H., Ha H., Lee Z.H.;
RT   "Histone deacetylase inhibitor MS-275 stimulates bone formation in
RT   part by enhancing Dhx36-mediated TNAP transcription.";
RL   J. Bone Miner. Res. 26:2161-2173(2011).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Proposed to have a global role in regulating mRNA
CC       expression including transcriptional regulation and mRNA
CC       stability. Binds with high affinity to and resolves tetramolecular
CC       RNA and DNA quadruplex structures. Unwinds intramolecular
CC       quadruplexes derived from the ZIC1 and the MYC promoters. Binds to
CC       quadruplex structures in the promoters of YY1 and ALPL genes and
CC       regulates their expression. Binds to telomerase RNA template
CC       component (TERC) 5'-end (nucleotides 1-43) and unwinds an internal
CC       quadruplex formation in TERC 5'-end to promote P1 helix formation;
CC       the P1 helix acts as a template boundary ensuring accurate reverse
CC       transcription and is disrupted by quadruplex formation. May be
CC       involved in regulation of telomere length. Plays a role in
CC       degradation and deadenylation of mRNAs containing in their 3'-UTR
CC       the consensus ARE sequence element. May function in sex
CC       development and spermatogenesis. May play a role in ossification.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21590736}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + H(2)O = ADP + phosphate.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with AGO1, AGO2, PARN, EXOSC3, EXOSC10, HDAC1
CC       and HDAC4. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:21590736}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Chromosome, telomere {ECO:0000250}. Note=Localizes
CC       to cytoplasmic stress granules. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The RHAU-specific motif (RSM) is required for quadruplex
CC       G4-DNA/RNA structure recognition and resolution. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the DEAD box helicase family. DEAH
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 helicase ATP-binding domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00541}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 helicase C-terminal domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00542}.

RP   ACETYLATION [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] AT LYS-172 AND LYS-176, AND
RP   IDENTIFICATION BY MASS SPECTROMETRY [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS].
RC   TISSUE=Embryonic fibroblast;
RX   PubMed=23806337; DOI=10.1016/j.molcel.2013.06.001;
RA   Park J., Chen Y., Tishkoff D.X., Peng C., Tan M., Dai L., Xie Z.,
RA   Zhang Y., Zwaans B.M., Skinner M.E., Lombard D.B., Zhao Y.;
RT   "SIRT5-mediated lysine desuccinylation impacts diverse metabolic
RT   pathways.";
RL   Mol. Cell 50:919-930(2013).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: As part of the heterotrimeric replication protein A
CC       complex (RPA/RP-A), binds and stabilizes single-stranded DNA
CC       intermediates, that form during DNA replication or upon DNA
CC       stress. It prevents their reannealing and in parallel, recruits
CC       and activates different proteins and complexes involved in DNA
CC       metabolism. Thereby, it plays an essential role both in DNA
CC       replication and the cellular response to DNA damage. In the
CC       cellular response to DNA damage, the RPA complex controls DNA
CC       repair and DNA damage checkpoint activation. Through recruitment
CC       of ATRIP activates the ATR kinase a master regulator of the DNA
CC       damage response. It is required for the recruitment of the DNA
CC       double-strand break repair factors RAD51 and RAD52 to chromatin in
CC       response to DNA damage. Also recruits to sites of DNA damage
CC       proteins like XPA and XPG that are involved in nucleotide excision
CC       repair and is required for this mechanism of DNA repair. Plays
CC       also a role in base excision repair (BER) probably through
CC       interaction with UNG. Through RFWD3 may activate CHEK1 and play a
CC       role in replication checkpoint control. Also recruits
CC       SMARCAL1/HARP, which is involved in replication fork restart, to
CC       sites of DNA damage. May also play a role in telomere maintenance.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P27694}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the canonical replication protein A complex
CC       (RPA), an heterotrimer composed of RPA1, RPA2 and RPA3. The DNA-
CC       binding activity may reside exclusively on the RPA1 subunit.
CC       Interacts with PRPF19; the PRP19-CDC5L complex is recruited to the
CC       sites of DNA repair where it ubiquitinates the replication protein
CC       A complex (RPA). Interacts with RIPK1. Interacts with the
CC       polymerase alpha subunit POLA1/p180; this interaction stabilizes
CC       the replicative complex and reduces the misincorporation rate of
CC       DNA polymerase alpha by acting as a fidelity clamp. Interacts with
CC       RAD51 and SENP6 to regulate DNA repair. Interacts with HELB; this
CC       interaction promotes HELB recruitment to chromatin following DNA
CC       damage. Interacts with PRIMPOL. Interacts with XPA; the
CC       interaction is direct and associates XPA with the RPA complex.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P27694}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus, PML body
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: DNA damage-induced 'Lys-63'-linked polyubiquitination by
CC       PRPF19 mediates ATRIP recruitment to the RPA complex at sites of
CC       DNA damage and activation of ATR. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P27694}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylated on lysine residues Lys-458 and Lys-586, with Lys-
CC       458 being the major site. Sumoylation promotes recruitment of
CC       RAD51 to the DNA damage foci to initiate DNA repair through
CC       homologous recombination. Desumoylated by SENP6 (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the replication factor A protein 1 family.
CC       {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 OB DNA-binding domain. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Binds to actin filaments in muscle and non-muscle cells.
CC       Plays a central role, in association with the troponin complex, in
CC       the calcium dependent regulation of vertebrate striated muscle
CC       contraction. Smooth muscle contraction is regulated by interaction
CC       with caldesmon. In non-muscle cells is implicated in stabilizing
CC       cytoskeleton actin filaments.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of an alpha and a beta chain. Interacts with
CC       HRG (via the HRR domain); the interaction contributes to the
CC       antiangiogenic properties of the histidine/proline-rich region
CC       (HRR) of HRG. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC         Comment=Additional isoforms seem to exist.;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=Skeletal muscle;
CC         IsoId=P58771-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=Fibroblast;
CC         IsoId=P58771-2; Sequence=VSP_006580;
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Induced in stimulated quiescent cells.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2521606}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: The molecule is in a coiled coil structure that is formed
CC       by 2 polypeptide chains. The sequence exhibits a prominent seven-
CC       residues periodicity.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated at Ser-283 by DAPK1 in response to oxidative
CC       stress and this phosphorylation enhances stress fiber formation in
CC       endothelial cells. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: The sequences of cardiac and skeletal muscles are
CC       identical.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the tropomyosin family. {ECO:0000305}.

RC   TISSUE=Brain, and Olfactory epithelium;
RX   PubMed=15489334; DOI=10.1101/gr.2596504;

RP   SUBCELLULAR LOCATION.
RX   PubMed=17360540; DOI=10.1073/pnas.0611360104;
RA   Moelleken J., Malsam J., Betts M.J., Movafeghi A., Reckmann I.,
RA   Meissner I., Hellwig A., Russell R.B., Sollner T., Brugger B.,
RA   Wieland F.T.;
RT   "Differential localization of coatomer complex isoforms within the
RT   Golgi apparatus.";
RL   Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U.S.A. 104:4425-4430(2007).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: The coatomer is a cytosolic protein complex that binds
CC       to dilysine motifs and reversibly associates with Golgi non-
CC       clathrin-coated vesicles, which further mediate biosynthetic
CC       protein transport from the ER, via the Golgi up to the trans Golgi
CC       network. Coatomer complex is required for budding from Golgi
CC       membranes, and is essential for the retrograde Golgi-to-ER
CC       transport of dilysine-tagged proteins. In mammals, the coatomer
CC       can only be recruited by membranes associated to ADP-ribosylation
CC       factors (ARFs), which are small GTP-binding proteins; the complex
CC       also influences the Golgi structural integrity, as well as the
CC       processing, activity, and endocytic recycling of LDL receptors (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Oligomeric complex. Binds to CDC42. Interacts with JAGN1.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:Q9UBF2}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm, cytosol
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:17360540}. Golgi apparatus membrane
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral membrane protein {ECO:0000250};
CC       Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasmic vesicle, COPI-coated
CC       vesicle membrane {ECO:0000250}; Peripheral membrane protein
CC       {ECO:0000250}; Cytoplasmic side {ECO:0000250}. Note=The coatomer
CC       is cytoplasmic or polymerized on the cytoplasmic side of the
CC       Golgi, as well as on the vesicles/buds originating from it. Tends
CC       to be more abundant in the trans-Golgi network compared to the
CC       cis-Golgi. {ECO:0000250}.

RX   PubMed=18955505; DOI=10.1128/MCB.00776-08;

RN   [5]
RP   FUNCTION, AND RNA-BINDING.
RX   PubMed=19470752; DOI=10.1128/MCB.00296-09;
RA   Yang X.-C., Torres M.P., Marzluff W.F., Dominski Z.;
RT   "Three proteins of the U7-specific Sm ring function as the molecular
RT   ruler to determine the site of 3'-end processing in mammalian histone
RT   pre-mRNA.";
RL   Mol. Cell. Biol. 29:4045-4056(2009).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Component of the cleavage and polyadenylation
CC       specificity factor (CPSF) complex that play a key role in pre-mRNA
CC       3'-end formation, recognizing the AAUAAA signal sequence and
CC       interacting with poly(A) polymerase and other factors to bring
CC       about cleavage and poly(A) addition. Has endonuclease activity,
CC       and functions as mRNA 3'-end-processing endonuclease. Also
CC       involved in the histone 3'-end pre-mRNA processing. U7 snRNP-
CC       dependent protein that induces both the 3' endoribonucleolytic
CC       cleavage of histone pre-mRNAs and acts as a 5' to 3' exonuclease
CC       for degrading the subsequent downstream cleavage product (DCP) of
CC       mature histone mRNAs. Cleavage occurs after the 5'-ACCCA-3'
CC       sequence in the histone pre-mRNA leaving a 3'hydroxyl group on the
CC       upstream fragment containing the stem loop (SL) and 5' phosphate
CC       on the downstream cleavage product (DCP) starting with CU
CC       nucleotides. The U7-dependent 5' to 3' exonuclease activity is
CC       processive and degrades the DCP RNA substrate even after complete
CC       removal of the U7-binding site. Binds to the downstream cleavage
CC       product (DCP) of histone pre-mRNAs and the cleaved DCP RNA
CC       substrate in a U7 snRNP dependent manner.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16213211, ECO:0000269|PubMed:18955505,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:19470752}.
CC   -!- COFACTOR:
CC       Name=Zn(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:29105; Evidence={ECO:0000250};
CC       Note=Binds 2 Zn(2+) ions per subunit. {ECO:0000250};
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of the cleavage and polyadenylation specificity
CC       factor (CPSF) complex, composed of CPSF1, CPSF2, CPSF3, CPSF4 and
CC       FIP1L1. Interacts with CPSF2, CSTF2 and SYMPK. Interacts with
CC       TUT1; the interaction is direct and mediates the recruitment of
CC       the CPSF complex on the 3'UTR of pre-mRNAs. Interacts with WDR33
CC       (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylated on Lys-462, Lys-465 and Lys-545, preferentially by
CC       SUMO3. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the metallo-beta-lactamase superfamily.
CC       RNA-metabolizing metallo-beta-lactamase-like family. CPSF3
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.

RA   Goriki A., Hatanaka F., Myung J., Kim J.K., Yoritaka T., Tanoue S.,

CC   -!- FUNCTION: Receptor for glucocorticoids (GC). Has a dual mode of
CC       action: as a transcription factor that binds to glucocorticoid
CC       response elements (GRE), both for nuclear and mitochondrial DNA,
CC       and as a modulator of other transcription factors. Affects
CC       inflammatory responses, cellular proliferation and differentiation
CC       in target tissues. Could act as a coactivator for STAT5-dependent
CC       transcription upon growth hormone (GH) stimulation and could
CC       reveal an essential role of hepatic GR in the control of body
CC       growth. Involved in chromatin remodeling. May play a negative role
CC       in adipogenesis through the regulation of lipolytic and
CC       antilipogenic genes expression. {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P04150,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21994940}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with GRIP1 (By similarity). Heteromultimeric
CC       cytoplasmic complex with HSP90AA1, HSPA1A/HSPA1B, and FKBP5 or
CC       another immunophilin such as PPID, STIP1, or the immunophilin
CC       homolog PPP5C. Upon ligand binding FKBP5 dissociates from the
CC       complex and FKBP4 takes its place, thereby linking the complex to
CC       dynein and mediating transport to the nucleus, where the complex
CC       dissociates. Directly interacts with UNC45A. Binds to DNA as a
CC       homodimer, and as heterodimer with NR3C2 or the retinoid X
CC       receptor. Binds STAT5A and STAT5B homodimers and heterodimers.
CC       Interacts with NRIP1, POU2F1, POU2F2 and TRIM28. Interacts with
CC       several coactivator complexes, including the SMARCA4 complex,
CC       CREBBP/EP300, TADA2L (Ada complex) and p160 coactivators such as
CC       NCOA2 and NCOA6. Interaction with BAG1 inhibits transactivation.
CC       Interacts with HEXIM1, PELP1 and TGFB1I1. Interacts with NCOA1,
CC       NCOA3, SMARCA4, SMARCC1, SMARCD1, and SMARCE1. Interacts with
CC       CLOCK, CRY1 and CRY2 in a ligand-dependent fashion. Interacts with
CC       CIART. Interacts with RWDD3. Interacts with UBE2I/UBC9 and this
CC       interaction is enhanced in the presence of RWDD3.
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P04150, ECO:0000269|PubMed:10678832,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:10848625, ECO:0000269|PubMed:11278753,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:21994940, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22170608,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:24736997, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9195923,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9528750, ECO:0000269|PubMed:9742105}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       O88485:Dync1i1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-492753, EBI-492834;
CC       P30416:Fkbp4; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-492753, EBI-492746;
CC       Q64378:Fkbp5; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-492753, EBI-492796;
CC       P11499:Hsp90ab1; NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-492753, EBI-492813;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P04150}.
CC       Mitochondrion {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus
CC       {ECO:0000250|UniProtKB:P04150}. Note=Cytoplasmic in the absence of
CC       ligand, nuclear after ligand-binding. The hormone-occupied
CC       receptor undergoes rapid exchange between chromatin and the
CC       nucleoplasmic compartment.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing, Alternative initiation; Named isoforms=4;
CC       Name=1; Synonyms=1-A, GR form A;
CC         IsoId=P06537-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2; Synonyms=2-A, GR form B;
CC         IsoId=P06537-2; Sequence=VSP_003704;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative splicing.;
CC       Name=1-B;
CC         IsoId=P06537-3; Sequence=VSP_018774;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative initiation at Met-28 of isoform 1.;
CC       Name=2-B;
CC         IsoId=P06537-4; Sequence=VSP_018774, VSP_003704;
CC         Note=Produced by alternative initiation at Met-28 of isoform 2.;
CC   -!- INDUCTION: Down-regulated by glucocorticoids.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Composed of three domains: a modulating N-terminal domain,
CC       a DNA-binding domain and a C-terminal ligand-binding domain.
CC   -!- PTM: Acetylation by CLOCK reduces its binding to glucocorticoid
CC       response elements and its transcriptional activity. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Increased proteasome-mediated degradation in response to
CC       glucocorticoids.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylated in the absence of hormone; becomes
CC       hyperphosphorylated in the presence of glucocorticoids. May be
CC       dephosphorylated by PPP5C, attenuates NR3C1 action.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:2019585, ECO:0000269|PubMed:21994940}.
CC   -!- PTM: Sumoylated; this reduces transcription transactivation.
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Ubiquitinated; restricts glucocorticoid-mediated
CC       transcriptional signaling. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:11555652}.
CC   -!- MISCELLANEOUS: T-cell is a critical cellular target of GR, as
CC       immune activation in mice lacking GR resulted in significant
CC       mortality. This lethal activation is rescued by PTGS2 inhibition
CC       but not steroid administration or cytokine neutralization.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the nuclear hormone receptor family. NR3
CC       subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 nuclear receptor DNA-binding domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00407}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: DNA- and RNA binding protein, involved in several
CC       nuclear processes. Binds the conventional octamer sequence in
CC       double-stranded DNA. Also binds single-stranded DNA and RNA at a
CC       site independent of the duplex site. Involved in pre-mRNA
CC       splicing, probably as a heterodimer with SFPQ. Interacts with U5
CC       snRNA, probably by binding to a purine-rich sequence located on
CC       the 3' side of U5 snRNA stem 1b. Together with PSPC1, required for
CC       the formation of nuclear paraspeckles. The SFPQ-NONO heteromer
CC       associated with MATR3 may play a role in nuclear retention of
CC       defective RNAs. The SFPQ-NONO heteromer may be involved in DNA
CC       unwinding by modulating the function of topoisomerase I/TOP1. The
CC       SFPQ-NONO heteromer may be involved in DNA non-homologous end
CC       joining (NHEJ) required for double-strand break repair and V(D)J
CC       recombination and may stabilize paired DNA ends. In vitro, the
CC       complex strongly stimulates DNA end joining, binds directly to the
CC       DNA substrates and cooperates with the Ku70/G22P1-Ku80/XRCC5 (Ku)
CC       dimer to establish a functional preligation complex. NONO is
CC       involved in transcriptional regulation. The SFPQ-NONO-NR5A1
CC       complex binds to the CYP17 promoter and regulates basal and cAMP-
CC       dependent transcriptional avtivity. NONO binds to an enhancer
CC       element in long terminal repeats of endogenous intracisternal A
CC       particles (IAPs) and activates transcription. Regulates the
CC       circadian clock by repressing the transcriptional activator
CC       activity of the CLOCK-ARNTL/BMAL1 heterodimer.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:22966205, ECO:0000269|PubMed:8355702,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:9001221}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Monomer and component of the SFPQ-NONO complex, which is
CC       probably a heterotetramer of two 52 kDa (NONO) and two 100 kDa
CC       (SFPQ) subunits. NONO is a component of spliceosome and U5.4/6
CC       snRNP complexes. Forms heterodimers with PSPC1; this involves
CC       formation of a coiled coil domain by helices from both proteins.
CC       Interacts with PSPC1 and SNRPA/U1A. Part of complex consisting of
CC       SFPQ, NONO and MATR3. Part of a complex consisting of SFPQ, NONO
CC       and NR5A1. Part of a complex consisting of SFPQ, NONO and TOP1.
CC       Interacts with SPI1. Interacts with RNF43. Interacts with PER1 and
CC       PER2. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15140795, ECO:0000269|PubMed:22966205,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:8626664}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       P17433:Spi1; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-607499, EBI-607588;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15860628}.
CC       Nucleus, nucleolus {ECO:0000250}. Nucleus speckle {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Note=Detected in punctate subnuclear structures often located
CC       adjacent to splicing speckles, called paraspeckles. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=1;
CC         IsoId=Q99K48-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=2;
CC         IsoId=Q99K48-2; Sequence=VSP_013981;
CC         Note=No experimental confirmation available.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Expressed in liver and suprachiasmatic nuclei,
CC       hippocampus and neocortex (at protein level). Detected in testis
CC       and kidney. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:15860628,
CC       ECO:0000269|PubMed:22966205}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 2 RRM (RNA recognition motif) domains.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00176}.

RN   [4] {ECO:0000305}
RP   DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE.
RX   PubMed=10727870; DOI=10.1016/S0925-4773(00)00243-4;
RA   Tarabykin V., Britanova O., Fradkov A., Voss A., Katz L.S.,
RA   Lukyanov S., Gruss P.;
RT   "Expression of PTTG and prc1 genes during telencephalic
RT   neurogenesis.";
RL   Mech. Dev. 92:301-304(2000).
CC   -!- FUNCTION: Key regulator of cytokinesis that cross-links
CC       antiparrallel microtubules at an average distance of 35 nM.
CC       Essential for controlling the spatiotemporal formation of the
CC       midzone and successful cytokinesis. Required for KIF14
CC       localization to the central spindle and midbody. Required to
CC       recruit PLK1 to the spindle. Stimulates PLK1 phosphorylation of
CC       RACGAP1 to allow recruitment of ECT2 to the central spindle (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Homodimer. Interacts with the C-terminal Rho-GAP domain
CC       and the basic region of RACGAP1. The interaction with RACGAP1
CC       inhibits its GAP activity towards CDC42 in vitro, which may be
CC       required for maintaining normal spindle morphology. Interacts
CC       separately via its N-terminal region with the C-terminus of CENPE,
CC       KIF4A and KIF23 during late mitosis. Interacts with KIF14 and
CC       KIF20A. Interacts with PLK1 (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Cytoplasm, cytoskeleton, spindle pole
CC       {ECO:0000250}. Note=Predominantly localized to the nucleus of
CC       interphase cells. During mitosis becomes associated with the
CC       mitotic spindle poles, and localizes with the cell midbody during
CC       cytokinesis (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- DEVELOPMENTAL STAGE: During the stages E11.5-E13.5 it is expressed
CC       in most embryonic tissues. Within the telencephalon, it is
CC       predominantly expressed inside the ventricular zone where
CC       expression reaches its peak at E15.5 and starts to decrease by
CC       E18.5. Expression is also observed in mitotically active cells
CC       outside the telencephalon, but not in adult brain.
CC       {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10727870}.
CC   -!- DOMAIN: Microtubule binding occurs via a basic patch in the
CC       central spectrin-like domain and requires also the unstructured C-
CC       terminal domain. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- PTM: Phosphorylation by CDK1 in early mitosis holds PRC1 in an
CC       inactive monomeric state, during the metaphase to anaphase
CC       transition, PRC1 is dephosphorylated, promoting interaction with
CC       KIF4A, which then translocates PRC1 along mitotic spindles to the
CC       plus ends of antiparallel interdigitating microtubules.
CC       Dephosphorylation also promotes MT-bundling activity by allowing
CC       dimerization. Phosphorylation by CDK1 prevents PLK1-binding: upon
CC       degradation of CDK1 at anaphase and dephosphorylation, it is then
CC       phosphorylated by PLK1, leading to cytokinesis (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the MAP65/ASE1 family. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SEQUENCE CAUTION:
CC       Sequence=BAC26320.1; Type=Miscellaneous discrepancy; Note=Probable intron retention.; Evidence={ECO:0000305};

CC   -!- FUNCTION: CaM-kinase II (CAMK2) is a prominent kinase in the
CC       central nervous system that may function in long-term potentiation
CC       and neurotransmitter release. Member of the NMDAR signaling
CC       complex in excitatory synapses it may regulate NMDAR-dependent
CC       potentiation of the AMPAR and synaptic plasticity (By similarity).
CC       {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
CC   -!- ENZYME REGULATION: Autophosphorylation of Thr-286 allows the
CC       kinase to switch from a calmodulin-dependent to a calmodulin-
CC       independent state. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: CAMK2 is composed of four different chains: alpha, beta,
CC       gamma, and delta. The different isoforms assemble into homo- or
CC       heteromultimeric holoenzymes composed of 8 to 12 subunits.
CC       Interacts with BAALC, MPDZ, SYN1, CAMK2N2 and SYNGAP1 (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- INTERACTION:
CC       Q9JI91:Actn2; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-400384, EBI-299169;
CC       Q9Z1R2:Bag6; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-400402, EBI-644645;
CC       Q62108:Dlg4; NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-400384, EBI-300895;
CC       Q00960:Grin2b (xeno); NbExp=3; IntAct=EBI-400384, EBI-396905;
CC       Q01097:Grin2b; NbExp=6; IntAct=EBI-400384, EBI-400125;
CC       P70587:Lrrc7 (xeno); NbExp=2; IntAct=EBI-400384, EBI-7798464;
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Isoform Alpha KAP: Cytoplasm {ECO:0000305}.
CC       Cell junction, synapse, presynaptic cell membrane {ECO:0000250}.
CC       Cell junction, synapse {ECO:0000250}. Note=Postsynaptic lipid
CC       rafts. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- ALTERNATIVE PRODUCTS:
CC       Event=Alternative splicing; Named isoforms=2;
CC       Name=Alpha CaMKII;
CC         IsoId=P11798-1; Sequence=Displayed;
CC       Name=Alpha KAP;
CC         IsoId=P11798-2; Sequence=VSP_004767, VSP_004768, VSP_004769;
CC         Note=Has no kinase activity.;
CC   -!- TISSUE SPECIFICITY: Isoform Alpha CaMKII is expressed in brain
CC       while isoform Alpha KAP is expressed in skeletal muscle.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. CAMK
CC       Ser/Thr protein kinase family. CaMK subfamily. {ECO:0000305}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Contains 1 protein kinase domain.
CC       {ECO:0000255|PROSITE-ProRule:PRU00159}.

CC   -!- FUNCTION: May be required for maintaining multiple types of adult
CC       stem cells. May function as a transcriptional repressor by
CC       continually deubiquiting histone H2B at the promoters of genes
CC       critical for cellular differentiation, thereby preventing histone
CC       H3 'Lys-4' trimethylation (H3K4) (By similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Thiol-dependent hydrolysis of ester,
CC       thioester, amide, peptide and isopeptide bonds formed by the C-
CC       terminal Gly of ubiquitin (a 76-residue protein attached to
CC       proteins as an intracellular targeting signal).
CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Interacts with PAF1. {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SUBCELLULAR LOCATION: Nucleus, nucleolus {ECO:0000250}.
CC   -!- SIMILARITY: Belongs to the peptidase C19 family. {ECO:0000305}.

CC   -!- SUBUNIT: Component of splicing factor SF3B complex which is
CC       composed of at least eight subunits; SF3B1, SF3B2, SF3B3, SF3B4,
CC       SF3B5, SF3B6, PHF5A/SF3B14B, and DDX42/SF3B125. SF3B associates
CC       with the splicing factor SF3A and a 12S RNA unit to form the U2
CC       small nuclear ribonucleoproteins complex (U2 snRNP). Component of
CC       the U11/U12 snRNPs that are part of the U12-type spliceosome (By
CC       similarity). {ECO:0000250}.
